channel.title: Bitcoins
channel.description: So apparently bitcoins are actually becoming a big deal. The bank of the US said they are thinking they will become the major currency for online transactions. Now my question is, how are buffoons secure? Can someone not just create bitcoins or do they use some type of encryption/hash for each bitcoin to ensure it is an actual bitcoin and who performs these hashes? I know very little about encryption but I feel like if someone was smart enough they could create their own bitcoins. Obviously this isn't the case if the bank of the US is thinking of adopting them, but I feel someone is making bank either way. Someone is generating these bitcoins and getting mass cash haha. Also there's massive amounts of money to be made flipping this currency. In a single day I've seen the price go from 1000-870-1230 all in oncle day haha. Flip two bitcoins a day and you are set for life.

item.title: Bitcoins
item.dc:creator: @Cole1497 Cole1497
item.description:
@Cole1497 wrote:

[quote=“zuppers, post:45, topic:536682”][quote author=Cole1497 link=topic=655492.msg4411768#msg4411768 date=1393988458]
crashed again, anyone here get fudgeed over by mtgox?
[/quote]Lost like 80USD worth of BTC but I didn’t spend a lot of time to get it so I don’t really care.[/quote]
Not a huge amount but nothing to sneeze at. There were claims on reddit of people losing over 1000BTC, which is foolish considering mtgox’s history, but I still sympathize with them

Read full topic

item.title: Bitcoins
item.dc:creator: @xxxtilllyxxx xxxtilllyxxx
item.description:
@xxxtilllyxxx wrote:

[quote=“xx matty xx, post:41, topic:536682”][quote author=xxxtilllyxxx link=topic=655492.msg4390941#msg4390941 date=1387490164]

Tired of all these kiddies who claim that they were thinking about buying into it. You’re the same tards that claimed you were going to buy nflx at $7 or apple when it was 20 cents. The reason you claim these things is because they already happened and you already know what to expect. When its YOUR money and not your parents and living on your own where you have to pay rent/mortgage and take care of your bills it’s completely different. It’s a risk. I am sure you will be the one that runs into the next big hyped stock/currency and when you buy in realize you made a mistake. Losing money is never fun and after you feel that burn you really get a sense of fkn reality.

So yea, I begged my parents at age 4 to buy apple stock when they were having a rough time and if they would of put $1000 down on it, we wouldn’t have to work again! I begged >:(

Get out of here with your bullshit.

I wasn’t begging for any of that. I had a feeling bitcoins would rise, considering the obvious. They get harder to mine later on, which means they have the ability to actually gain value. What bullshit lol? There’s a lot of people who wanted to buy bitcoins. My dad has my funds frozen, I can’t touch it till he tells me I can. Doubt what you want, I frequently invest though.
[/quote]I’m printing mattytokens. I intend to print fewer and fewer of them over time so they’ll go up in value eventually, right? Let me know if you want to invest now while the price is low ($45USD/token).[/quote]

There’s a difference between a niche product which has actual potential to catch on, verses some get rich quick scheme

Read full topic

item.title: Bitcoins
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

[quote=“Rodgerwilco, post:36, topic:536682”]Tired of all these kiddies who claim that they were thinking about buying into it. You’re the same tards that claimed you were going to buy nflx at $7 or apple when it was 20 cents. The reason you claim these things is because they already happened and you already know what to expect. When its YOUR money and not your parents and living on your own where you have to pay rent/mortgage and take care of your bills it’s completely different. It’s a risk. I am sure you will be the one that runs into the next big hyped stock/currency and when you buy in realize you made a mistake. Losing money is never fun and after you feel that burn you really get a sense of fkn reality.

So yea, I begged my parents at age 4 to buy apple stock when they were having a rough time and if they would of put $1000 down on it, we wouldn’t have to work again! I begged >:(

Get out of here with your bullshit.[/quote]

Yeah… you’re wrong, unfortunately. I had £300 of my own money and asked my parents to put in around £200 of their own each, which we could have then bought Bitcoins together and profited off it as a family. It wasn’t a passing thought one day as I looked out the bus window, I physically put money towards it but I was too young to wiretransfer it in order to buy Bitcoins, and my parents wouldn’t do it as they thought I’d lose a lot of money.

Read full topic

item.title: Bitcoins
item.dc:creator: @xxxtilllyxxx xxxtilllyxxx
item.description:
@xxxtilllyxxx wrote:

[quote=“Ambokile, post:34, topic:536682”][quote author=xxxtilllyxxx link=topic=655492.msg4390805#msg4390805 date=1387435747]
I fudgeing hate bitcoins. I wanted to invest into them, (I frequently invest) and my dad wouldn’t trust an internet currency, then they went from 50$ each, to 200$ each, now they were just at $1000.00 each. Fuck me…
[/quote]

When they were $0.50 each, I begged my parents to put $1000.00 down into Bitcoins. They told me that I didn’t know what I was talking about. Seeing them hit $1000.00 each was saddening to say the least.[/quote]

I know how you feel. Debating the #bitcoin suicide hotline atm… Fuck my life. I’d be fucking rich. Urghhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh

Read full topic

xxxtilllyxxx:

When they were $0.50 each, I begged my parents to put $1000.00 down into Bitcoins. They told me that I didn’t know what I was talking about. Seeing them hit $1000.00 each was saddening to say the least.

item.title: Bitcoins
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

I saw a Princeton economist write about bitcoins saying the only use they have is for drug cartels and weapon dealers. Which is my thoughts. Apparently people like the transparency of the transactions even if they are not dealing in illegal activities though. That’s the only logical explanation I can come up with for why people would adopt these.

Read full topic

item.title: Bitcoins
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“Slave Scyth, post:21, topic:536682”]There’s a reason Congress, Bank of America and a ton of organizations have put effort into adopting Bitcoin. It’s a viable currency.

I think it’s funny that anybody in this thread feels they have the knowledge to know better than huge corporations and the government, especially considering it’s very doubtful when anybody on this site claims to be above the age of 15.

Anybody on this site’s credentials are nothing compared to the people supporting Bitcoin.[/quote]that’s including yourself then mate, or are you one of the exceptions?

Read full topic
